main event: On September 20, 1954 in New York, NY, two irregularly shaped yellowish objects were observed, approximately 100 yards apart, with flashing lights and vapor spurting from the sides. The observation lasted for 3 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as irregularly round and yellowish, with flashing lights and vapor spurting from the sides.
The observation took place in New York, NY, with cloudy and overcast weather conditions.
The objects were observed heading west at the same level, approximately 100 yards apart.
The report indicates that the description is characteristic of an aircraft, suggesting a prosaic explanation for the sighting.
The observer had previously seen a similar incident at the same place, indicating a possible pattern of sightings in the area.
sighted object: two irregularly shaped yellowish objects with flashing lights and vapor spurting
